name: St. Kitts Marriott Resort & The Royal Beach Casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Marriott in St. Kitts was HUGE! One of the biggest places I've been to. The rooms were huge, and beautiful, the bathroom was beautiful, the grounds were beautiful, the beach was big, altho the water swimming area was small but still pretty. They had great food at all the specialty rest. Loved this place, and when I return here I'd probably stay here again.
reviews.title: Lovely St. Kitts!

likes.disliked: — lack of ocean to swim in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We Loved this island as well. It had great scenery, which im big on and I loved the people here, very welcoming and great at giving tips to local places. We took a catamaran tour to shitten bay and all around the island of st kitts as well as to Nevis where we stayed about two hours. The Catamaran was great as well as Nevis, beaches were beautiful, lush tropical island. We were right in front of the Four seasons and they had an amazing spot!
reviews.title: Great Resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: On St Kitts, we hit two other beaches besides the hotels, we went to to Turtle bay, which was small, but nice, little crowded tho, but facilities and dining. Then we went to Cockleshell Bay, which was AMAZING! We were the only two on the whole beach. And I am not exaggerating! this was during mid June, no one was there, we had the whole beach too ourselves, with swaying palms, we just layed under them and swam in the water all to ourselves! And the water was gorgeous, much better then Turtle bay, and it's just on the other side and no one even knew about it. There is a bar and bathrooms on Cockleshell, but no one was there when we were there, but we didn't care we couldn't get over we had this place to ourselves, it was like
reviews.title: Vacation Highlights

likes.liked: — The courtesy of the hotel staff and the room's view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we were stranded on a deserted Island and we were in Heaven.
reviews.title: Great Place
First time in the Carribean Great Vacation!
reviews.text: Come to St. Kitts and Nevis, great place, good food, beautiful beaches, stay at the Marriott as well, you shouldn't be dissapointed,

reviews.title: Unspoiled St. Kitts, but no Drunk Monkeys
reviews.text: We stayed at the Marriott on the first leg of our Honeymoon in October. It was the off-season so the hotel was very quiet, fine by us. Great views, nice rooms, expensive food in the restaurants, but good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We hired Mr. Cool a local cab driver to do a tour of the island one day, and a trip to Basseterre another day. Mr. Cool was great and showed us much of the island.
reviews.title: Great Vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided on St. Kitts because of the famous drinking monkeys and the pig Wilbur at Turtle Beach. The restaurant is no longer there--on drinks no monkeys! Wilbur is still there though.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

likes.disliked: — Locals on the beach pushing foot massage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good snorkeling and good food at South Friar's beach, The Shipwreck is a small cafe owned by an American woman. We saw octopus, squid, and lots of sea urchins. We had the beach entirely to ourselves!
reviews.title: Best Vacation in Years

likes.liked: — Very Large and very nice rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: St. Kitts is unspoiled compared to many other parts of the Caribbean, it would be wonderful it it stayed that way....
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: All in all it was a great vacation and I would go back in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: Loved St. Kitts & St. Kitts Marriott

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our trip to St. Kitts was August 3- 8 and we loved it. St. Kitts is a very beautiful island. Upon arrival we were greeted with cool towels, refreshing bunch, and very friendly greeters at the Marriott. The Marriott was beautiful. The grounds were A++.
reviews.title: very beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our all inclusive package also included a $100 food & beverage coupon that we received at check-in. The all inclusive package covered all meals at the restaurants except The Royal Grill, the Grill has a $35 per person surcharge for the all inclusive package. We were able to apply this $100 food & beverage coupon so only had to pay $17 for all 3 of us to eat there.
reviews.title: Wonderful 2nd Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The rooms were beautiful, clean, and spacious. We had a King room with a view of the mountains and the golf course, the mountains were beautifully lite at night. The beach was beautiful and good for snorkeling. The food and service was very good at all of the restaurants except for The Royal Grill. We only paid $17 for a 200+ meal but it wasn't worth the $17. The service was horrible. They were out of lobster, we asked for shrimp, we were told that they did not have shrimp, but after viewing the menu again, we saw prawns on the menu. The prawns were the size of a medium shrimp, so we knew they were not prawns by their size and texture. We also ordered the Kobe Filet Mignon, we were told that it was 8 ounces, but mind was only 2 ounces and my sons was 6 - 8 ounces. My 2 ounce Kobe Filet Mignon was good, although it was very small. I don't know if it was an off night or what for The Royal Grill, but it was not a good one for us or the family sitting next to us. The gentleman order Prime Rib, which he did not received. He asked the server, "Is this Prime Rib ?", he was told yes. He picked up his steak and looked at it again with displeasure.
reviews.title: Fun at the Marriott

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I planned a vacation trip to St. Kitts this year and we stayed at the Marriott. We primarily chose this for the golf course and the Carribean. The hotel was nice and our room was large and very clean. The restaurants were good, especially the Blu seafood and La Cucina italian restaurant. The Cafe Calypso which serves bearkfast, lunch and dinner was also good. We chose the all inclusive plan and it was a good decision, however, some liquor is not included and will cost extra. The Royal St. Kitts Golf Club course was just down the street, and very nice. The golf course staff was very friendly and helpful. Most of the days we played, we were alone on the course, which was well maintained. The beach at the Marriott was very disappointing. All beaches are public, and you can't go on them without being constantly hassled by the locals wanting to sell you things, braid your hair or rub your feet. As I was swimming in the ocean, which seemed great, I discovered garbage floating by me (at the hotel beach). As we walked down the beach, it looked like a landfill, with all sorts of garbage, bottles, oil cans, handiwipes and other undesirable material on the shore. This discourage us from doing any more swimming in the ocean, so we decided to stick to the pool. This also seemed nice, but be aware that you cannot leave anything alone at the hotel pools for any amount of time. We had two MP3 players and towels stolen from the North pool, and the hotel wouldn't re-imburse us. This incident and the condition of the beach has discouraged us from ever returning to this resort. We expect high quality for our vacations and this one didn't deliver. Thank God for the golf!
reviews.title: St. Kitts Marriott Disappoining

likes.disliked: — Garbage on the beach, items stolen from pool.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007
reviews.text: Just returned on 08/18/07 from the Marriott St. Kitts. Had a wonderful stay. The hotel is beautiful, the staff is quite cordial, and the food was terrific! The Kittitians are good, hard working people who make your stay very comfortable. The island terrain is mountainous & beautiful. The beaches are very clean & pristine. A little seeweed never hurt anyone.The water is a nice color green. Please go see "Lion Rock" on Banana Bay as he prepares you a terrific lunch and his signature "Lion Rock Punch" which packs a wallop! Take a 40 minute ferry ride to Nevis and visit Pinney Beach. Sit down and have a "Killer Bees Punch". Walk on Pinney's Beach to the Four Season's Resort Nevis to see luxury at its best! The Marriott staff kept its hotel guests in lockdown mode on Friday due to the effects of Dean. Can't blame them, the waves were incredible! Calypso Cafe was the Jack of All Trades Restaurant, though not 5 star. Blu, Royal Grill & La Cucina were all excellent. Get the all inclusive package if you have kids. It saved us some $$! The casino is fun too! If you want to relax, get away from it all and have some fun with your family, then the St. Kitts Marriott is just what the doctor ordered. It's not the best place I've stayed in, but it was one of the more pleasurable.
reviews.title: Dean and the Marriott

likes.disliked: — Did not upgrade to Oceanview Room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the first time we had been out of the country and it started off really rough. Our flight was awful but once we got to the Marriott we felt more at ease. Luckily, Calypso served dinner until 10 pm so we ate a late dinner but got food! Our travel agent booked us with GoGo Tours so we set up our activities and adventures through a GoGo Tour guide that came to the Marriott (it was a little cheaper than booking activities through the hotel)! We took a half day tour of the island, hiked up the volcano and took a catamaran to Nevis (the ride to the port was included in the booking)--we didn't get to see much of Nevis but definitely want to go back. Every activity we did was well worth it and worth the money (and inexpensive), if you like history and adventure! The restaurants at the Marriott were nice--Blu was yummy, great place for seafood and beautiful ocean view, La Cucina was good Italian food and Calypso, good for a quick bite to eat. They also had Bohemia Beach Bar (which has a swim up bar) and the Pizza Shack for lunch or an afternoon snack. I loved that the Calypso Café was open 24 hours—they had drinks for late nights and were there for a quick to-go breakfast. Tip—an all-inclusive package is the way to go. It included all restaurants and bars except the Royal Grille Steakhouse and The Keys Rum/Cigar Bar. The Marriott had a large pool but was crowded most of the time. Usually they offered nightly entertainment ....one night they had karaoke, which we missed out on but heard it was tons of fun. One thing I do wish they would have recognized was that were we were honeymooners. A couple we met that was staying at the hotel got a complimentary bottle of champagne and dessert and then got a complimentary bottle of wine at Blu---we had to practically beg for our champagne and dessert! Also, if you’re looking for a romantic couple’s getaway--there were a lot of families vacationing--and few couples. The hotel did have a beach but the water was rough---so we took a short taxi ride to Turtle Beach. If you go to St. Kitts you have to go to Turtle Beach….at least one time! They have a gift shop and restaurant and it's a great place to snorkel. Turtle Beach is famous for its monkeys but also has a pet pig, goats and cats running around! I also got an aloe foot rub on the beach from an islander and it was wonderful! A beach just a 15 minutes walk from the hotel was Friar's Beach (located on the Caribbean side)--and it was safe to walk. Lots of shells...also had bars/restaurants and local people selling St. Kitts souvenirs. Although the trip started rough, we will definitely be back to the Marriott in St. Kitts and Nevis....maybe with kids next time to share the fun. If you are looking for fun, adventure, history and relaxation, St. Kitts and Nevis definitely has all.
reviews.title: our honeymoon!

likes.liked: — beautiful views of the mountain side and Atlantic Ocean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was an amazing location. It you are looking for a tranquil, quiet place, maybe not for you, but this hotel lives up to and exceeds my expecations of the Marriott name.
reviews.title: Loved It! Would Go Again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Signature Vacations "adjusted" our stay and forgot to tell the hotel. When the 7 of us got there, there was not enough room at the Inn, so the Marriott upgraded us so that we would be taken care of. From that point on, our stay was amazing.
reviews.title: Just got back....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The only room for improvement would be the restaurant. They ran out of things a couple of times (like bagels for breakfast), but I guess it isn't easy to import. Definitely eat the seafood and try the Brinley's Rum - wish we could get it here in Canada.
reviews.title: Truly a Caribbean delight!

likes.disliked: — Restaurants were a bit pricy for the value

reviews.title: Reminded us of the Hawaiin Islands
reviews.text: We went to St. Kitts to celebrate my 50th birthday and we were not disappointed. The island is very beautiful with its foliage and green mountain sides. The weather was warm and somewhat humid but perfect for the pool or beach. The hotel lived up to the great standards of the Marriott. We had a pool view (north pool) room in the Tabernacle building. Although I would have liked an unobstructed view of the pool, I wasn't in my room much to really care. The room was spacious and the king size bed was very comfortable. The breakfast food was very good as well as the lunch and snacks. Only ate dinner at the Blu Seafood on property and that was very good although it was a limited seafood menu. The service throughout the hotel was superb. The front desk, managers on duty, bar tenders and wait staff were all very friendly and helpful. I didn't experience one unhappy employee. Because the 10% sevice charge that St. Kitts adds to every thing you purchase, we had a few couples ask us if they should tip more. We always told them to tip more if the service was good to at least equal the 20% you would normally give for good service. We tipped everyone and felt it was very appreciated. We also ate some dinners off property and our favorite was Marshalls. YOU MUST EAT AT MARSHALLS. The food was fabulous and the prices were reasonable. It was just a short cab ride from the Marriott. We also booked the horse back ride through the hotel which was with Royal Stables. Jackie was our guide and he was very good about making sure we were safe on the ride. If you do this, you must ask Jackie to sing....his voice is like heaven! All in all, our trip to St. Kitts was one we will always remember and plan to return. On a scale from 1 to 10, we rate this island and hotel a 9!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Feel free to contact me if you have any questions.
reviews.title: Not our favorite Marriott experience
Great Resort
reviews.text: We originally booked our stay at the Marriott for October 28-November 2nd, but we checked out on October 21st. This trip was our honeymoon and the Marriott was our second leg. We started our honeymoon on Nevis at the Four Seasons. Anyway, the Marriott was fairly nice, but left something to be desired. My first impression of the resort was that it reminded me of a hotel you would find in Orlando or an apartment complex even. It lacked character. We usually stay at Marriotts when we travel, but this is my least favorite Marriott. Compared with the Wailea Marriott on Maui and the Casa Magna Marriott in Puerto Vallarta, the St. Kitts resort was just average.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007
reviews.text: While service was not "terrible", it certainly was not better than average. The staff to guest ratio seemed like 10:1, but that didn't add to the quality of service. Staff attitude was indifferent to rude (with the exception of the bell staff at the front door). There would be 5-7 waitresses in the Calypso restaurant in the morning just standing up against a wall staring at the guests eating. No one would check on you or ask how your meal was, but the second you put your fork down, they would take your plate and utensils (it was a buffet). Spoons were also a rarity in the morning at Calypso (not sure why). It was always a surprise when you unraveled your napkin to unveil your utensils. The waitresses always forgot something, i.e. I would order tea and they would forget to either get it completely or give me a component (tea bag, hot water, milk). The breakfast buffet was just average. The waffles and pancakes were always soggy. I would say that the breakfast food was on the level of Denny's.
reviews.title: loved the Marriott

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I visited St KItts at the end of Oct. '07. We saw several other hotels and never regretted our choice to stay at the Marriott. Check in was pleasant with a warm welcome to St KItts. Our room was spacious, had an ocean view, and was very clean. The property was beautiful and the landscaping well kept. The pools were nice as well, though the main pool could stand to be cleaned better with a fresh coat of paint. The beach was gorgeous. The hotel had their swimming area walled off with rocks to calm the water from the Atlantics' waves. We treated ourselves to a couples massage at their spa. The staff and the facility were 1st class. The restaurants were very nice but pricy. The service also could be slow at times though this is common anywhere in the caribbean. We purchased a breakfast package allowing us the buffet every morning. This was a good value considering it would have been $50 for the both of us otherwise. I recommend this option. They had several places to have an evening cocktail. The cigar bar is a nice option if you don't mind smoke. It isn't as crowded as the lobby bar. The hotel also had an on-site casino with plenty of machines and tables. Sadly, though, betting on the Bears doesn't help the result. Overall our whole trip was fantastic thanks to the people of St Kitts that we met. Most of them the Marriotts' staff.I can't wait to go back!!
reviews.title: Fantastic Resort

likes.liked: — The people and the property were 1st rate.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Reception Staff were excellent, esp Mrs M. Went out of her way to help

reviews.title: Additional comment from Ludie for St. Kitts Marriott
reviews.text: Guest from the UK

aka: St. Kitts Marriott Resort & The Royal Beach Hotel
description: The Marriott St. Kitts Resort & Royal Beach Casino captivates you from the moment you see it, immersing you in the culture and atmosphere of this most relaxing and romantic of Caribbean Islands. Our breathtaking St. Kitts resort hotel offers an unparalleled island vacation experience. Luxury guest rooms, trimmed with West Indian accents and cutting-edge comforts, are spacious and welcoming. That same Caribbean flavor sets the tone in our 8 restaurants and 2 lounges. For entertainment and relaxation, the resort also offers the 35,000 sq ft Royal Beach Casino, the 15,000 sq ft Emerald Mist Spa and boasts an 18-hole championship golf course at the Royal St. Kitts Golf Club.
